ChangeDescriptions.ChangeDescription: Version 2.37: Changed 'Capacity' display name to 'Initial Capacity' as object capacities are now user assignable.

Version 2.39: Updated the Combiner object process logic to specify all of the object's process delays as non-interruptible except for the 'ProcessingTime' delay in the 'OnEnteredProcessing' process. The 'OnEnteredProcessing' process was changed from a private process to a public process. Added a 'State Assignments' property category.

Version 2.40: 'On Shift' or 'Off Shift' add-on process triggers are now called when initializing the object even if a work schedule is not specified. In the object process logic, the 'Action' property for all Execute steps executing an 'add-on process' is now specified as 'WaitUntilCompleted'. Restructured the failure-related process logic.

Version 2.41: Changed the name of the Combiner object's BatchLogic element from 'CombinerBatch' to 'Batching' and made it a public element. Updated the assignments repeat groups to take state units into account.

Version 3.42: Changes related to setting the 'Token Associated Object Destroyed Action' option for process logic in this object. The EntryRankingRule and EntryRankingExpression properties of the ParentInputBuffer and MemberInputBuffer stations were changed to be the same as the Combiner's matching logic parent and member ranking rules.
Version 3.44: 'SeizedObjects.UnitsOwned' function renamed to 'SeizedObjects.CapacityUnitsOwned'.
Version 3.47: Added a 'Secondary Resources' property category. Added new 'Appearance' property category.

Version 3.49: Specified the 'OnAssociatedObjectTransferRequested' property of some processes as 'EndProcess'. Collapsed the 'Secondary Resources->Other Resource Seizes' & 'Secondary Resources->Other Resource Releases' property categories by default.
Version 3.50: Updated the description text for some of the secondary resource related properties.
Version 3.52: If the model's 'Disable Randomness' option is being used, the object's 'Reliability Logic' is now automatically disabled to not generate any failure occurrences.
Version 3.53: Property display names 'Request Visit', 'Node Name', and 'Visit Priority' renamed to 'Request Move', 'Destination Node', and 'Move Priority'.

Version 3.54: Usage of 'Run.RandomnessDisabled' function instead of deprecated 'DisableRandomness' function. Added support for 'Processing Time Based' failure type. Conversion to 'OnRunInitialized' standard interface process. Added 'Run Ending' add-on process trigger.
Version 3.56: Conversion to 'OnEvaluatingSeizeRequest' standard interface process.
Version 4.58: Added new 'Advanced Options' property category.
Version 4.60: Process logic now uses new object 'SeizedResources.CapacityUnitsOwned' function instead of deprecated 'SeizedObjects.CapacityUnitsOwned'.
Version 4.61: Added new 'Financials' property category.
Version 4.62: Added new 'Financials->Buffer Costs property category.

Version 4.63: Reordered the position of the 'Financials' property category. 'Processing' add-on process trigger now always executed after entity enters the 'Processing' station. Added new 'Financials->Resource Costs' property category.
Version 4.64: Added a 'Random' selection goal option to the 'Secondary Resources' functionality.

Version 4.65: Process logic now uses new object 'SeizedResources.CapacityOwnedOf' function instead of deprecated 'SeizedResources.CapacityUnitsOwned'. 'Repairing' add-on process trigger marked as obsolete and is no longer displayed in the Properties window if not previously defined.

Version 4.68: Simplified 'OnExitedProcessing' process by eliminating Decide step to check whether token has an associated object. Renamed 'InitializedAddOnProcess' property to 'RunInitializedAddOnProcess'. Added new 'Before Processing' add-on process trigger.
Version 4.71: Renamed 'EventName' property to 'FailureEventName'.

Version 4.72: Renamed 'Processed' add-on process name to 'AfterProcessing'. An initial (default) property value is now specified for the 'Sequence Expected Operation Time' property of the combiner's 'ParentInput' node.
Version 5.87: Process logic now uses new property 'HasValue' function instead of deprecated 'IsDefined'.

Version 5.91: Minor display name related update of buffer capacity-related properties. Secondary Resources feature -> Now hides the 'ParentObject' object type choice. Added information to indicate which properties to display if the new 'Show Commonly Used Properties Only' option is enabled.

Version 5.95: 'OnExitedProcessing' process logic now checks that token has an associated object before attempting to release the Combiner. Updates to the 'OnFailed', 'OnRepaired', 'OnEvaluatingSeizeRequest', and 'OnCapacityChanged' process logic.
Version 5.96: Added new 'Evaluating Seize Request' add-on process trigger.
Version 6.103: Some property description updates.
Version 6.106: Required update due to TransferNode object updates.
Version 7.121: Miscellaneous maintenance updates.
Version 7.122: Required update due to TransferNode object updates.
Version 7.123: In 'Secondary Resources' property category, added options to keep released resources reserved for possible later reuse by the same entity.
Version 7.127: Updates to support new 'Release Quantity Type' property on Release step.
Version 7.130: Added 'Advanced Options -> Obsolete Properties' property category. Added new 'Process Type' option to support modeling processing at the combiner as a task sequence.
Version 7.131: Required update due to BasicNode & TransferNode object updates. 'Secondary Resources -> Other Resource Releases' repeat groups include new 'Release Quantity Type' property.
Version 8.133: Required update due to BasicNode & TransferNode object updates.
Version 8.134: Required update due to BasicNode & TransferNode object updates.
Version 8.135: Edited the default value of new 'ExpectedOperationTimeExpression' property.
Version 8.136: Simplification of 'OnCapacityChanged', 'OnFailed', & 'OnRepaired' process logic to use fewer Suspend & Resume steps. Simplification of 'OnRunInitialized' process logic.
Version 8.137: New 'Task Precedence Method' option for 'Task Sequence' process type. Simplification of 'OnFailed' process logic to use fewer Suspend & Resume steps.
Version 8.140: Added new 'Off Shift Rule' option to suspend processing or finish work already started if the combiner is at the end of a shift because of its specified work schedule.
Version 8.141: Added new 'Material Requirements -> Lot ID' property to 'Processing Tasks' repeat group.

Version 8.142: 'PerformProcessingTask' process logic - If wrong action type, Consume & Produce steps now skip the consumption or production attempt instead of using a zero quantity. Added 'Repaired' event and failure-related timers now use that event as their reset triggering event.
Version 8.143: Added 'Sequence Dependent Setup' task process type to 'Processing Tasks' repeat group.
Version 8.144: Added 'Setup' and 'OffShiftSetup' resource state tracking.
Version 8.145: 'Redirect Location Type' property of OutputBuffer station specified as 'ParentExternalNode' with redirect external node name 'Output'.

Version 8.146: Renamed 'Buffer Capacity' property category to 'Buffer Logic'. Added parent input, member input, & output buffer balking options. Added warnings on run initialization if the capacity of either the parent or member input buffers is specified as zero.
Version 8.147: Added new 'Table Row Referencing' property category. Added optional 'Before Processing' and 'After Processing' state assignments.
Version 9.149: Added Buffer Logic -> Balking & Reneging Options -> Renege Triggers. Added 'Failed' event & changed scope of 'Repaired' event from private to public.
Version 9.150: Added new 'Submodel Entity Creation Method' option for 'Submodel' task process type if using task sequences.

Version 9.154: Failure-related timers now reset by a 'FailuresTimerReset' event (fired after Repair step in 'FailureOccurrenceLogic') instead of by the 'Repaired' event. The 'Uptime Between Failures' of the Processing Time Based failure type now includes time spent in the OffShiftProcessing and FailedProcesssing states.
Version 9.155: Added new 'Must Simultaneously Seize' option for secondary resource related features.
Version 9.158: Required update due to TransferNode object update.
Version 9.159: LogResourceUsage property mapped down to LogTasks property of ProcessingTaskSequence element.
Version 9.160: New OnCapacityChangedProcess property added to Seize step.
Version 9.161: Property description updates.
Version 9.162: Added new 'Off Shift Rule' option to suspend processing or finish work already started if a secondary resource is at the end of a shift because of its specified work schedule.

Version 9.163: Made visible the new 'Off Shift Rule' options for secondary resources. Added new 'Task Ready' add-on process trigger option if using task sequence. Renamed 'SecondaryResourceForProcessingRequestVisit' property to 'SecondaryResourceForProcessingRequestMove'. Renamed 'SecondaryResourceForProcessingNodeName' to 'SecondaryResourceForProcessingDestinationNode'.

Version 9.164: If the resource state is 'OffShiftProcessing' or 'OffShiftSetup' and a failure occurs, then the resource state is now set to 'Failed'. If the resource state is 'OffShiftProcessing' and all entities have finished processing and are trying to transfer out, then the resource state is now set to 'OffShift'. Secondary Resources -> Other Resource Seizes properties - Renamed 'SecondaryResourceSeizesRequestVisit' properties to 'SecondaryResourceSeizesRequestMove'. Renamed 'SecondaryResourceSeizesNodeName' properties to 'SecondaryResourceSeizesDestinationNode'. Renamed 'SecondaryResourceSeizesVisitPriority' properties to 'SecondaryResourceSeizesMovePriority'. Renamed 'Matching Logic' property category to 'Batching Logic'.
Version 10.166: Property description updates.
Version 10.167: Added new 'Suspend Batching When Down' option.
Version 10.171: Processing Tasks - Auto Cancel Trigger property description update.
Version 10.172: OnSecondaryResourceCapacityChanged process -> Decide 'IfOffShift' step -> Use Object.Capacity.Previous function instead of Capacity.Previous.
Version 10.172: Added Loopback Branches feature to Task Sequence process type.
Version 10.173: Added optional task state assignments.
Version 10.174: Required update due to TransferNode object update.
Version 10.175: Added Processing Tasks -> Material Requirements -> InventorySiteType & SiteObjectName properties.
Version 10.179: Added OnConsumedProcess property to Consume step and RecordAsOrderReceivedCondition property to Produce step.
Version 10.183: Added Batching Logic -> Batch Quantities repeat group and Must Simultaneously Batch property.
Version 10.184: Added Batching Logic -> Release Batch Early Triggers repeat group.
Version 10.185: Added 'Switch Resources If Possible' off shift rule for secondary resources.
Version 10.186: Fixes to 'Switch Resources If Possible' off shift rule for secondary resources.
Version 10.187: Process logic implementation of 'Switch Resources If Possible' off shift rule for secondary resources no longer uses Delay epsilon steps.
Version 11.188: Added new 'Immediately Try Seize' and 'Immediately Try Allocate When Released' options for the combiner and secondary resources.
Version 11.190: Added resource efficiency related properties.
Version 11.191: Exposed new resource efficiency related properties.

Version 11.192: Added new Secondary Resources -> For Processing -> Repeat Group option. Renamed 'SecondaryResourceForProcessingImmediatelyTrySeize' property to 'SecondaryResourcesForProcessingImmediatelyTrySeize'. Renamed 'SecondaryResourceForProcessingImmediatelyTryAllocateWhenReleased' property to 'SecondaryResourcesForProcessingImmediatelyTryAllocateWhenReleased'.

Version 11.192: Renamed 'SecondaryResourceForProcessingOffShiftRule' property to 'SecondaryResourcesForProcessingOffShiftRule'. Added 'Resource Efficiency' and 'Immediately Try Seize' properties to 'Secondary Resources -> Other Resource Seizes' repeat groups. Added 'Immediately Try Allocate When Released' property to 'Secondary Resources -> Other Resource Releases' repeat groups
Version 11.193: Task Material Requirements - Optional 'Lot ID' property if producing or consuming material from an inventory site.

Version 11.194: For greater compatibility with standard Overall Equipment Effectiveness (OEE) definition, changed the utilization calculation setting of the 'Setup' & 'OffShiftSetup' resource states from IncludeUnitsAllocated to ExcludeUnitsAllocated. Secondary Resources - Added 'Skip Requirement If' property to optionally skip a secondary resource requirement. Secondary Resources -> Other Resource Releases properties - Renamed 'Release Condition' properties to 'Selection Condition'. Task Material Requirements - Added 'Skip Requirement If' property to optionally skip a material requirement. Deprecated the Task Material Requirements -> Production Delay Time property.
Version 11.195: Misc property display category changes. Secondary Resources -> Other Resource Seizes/Releases -> Added 'Skip Seize/Release If' Properties.
Version 11.198: Task Material Requirements - Added 'Must Simultaneously Consume' option.
Version 11.199: Fixes to 'Switch Resources If Possible' off shift rule for secondary resources.
Version 11.203: Added 'Seize Constraint Logic' property.

Version 11.204: PerformProcessingTask process logic - Added ProcessingTaskToken.ExpectedSetupTime state assignment to get an expected setup time. Secondary Resource Requirements -> Renamed 'SelectionExpression' properties to 'SelectionValueExpression'.

Version 12.207: Renamed secondary resource-related properties 'ObjectType', 'ObjectName', 'ObjectListName', 'NumberOfObjects', & 'UnitsPerObject' to 'ResourceType', 'ResourceName', 'ResourceListName', 'NumberOfResources',.& 'UnitsPerResource' respectively.
Version 12.212: Required update due to BasicNode and TransferNode object updates.
Version 12.216: 'Units Per Resource' properties can now be specified as a candidate resource-dependent value.
Version 14.225: Updated External View graphics to rotate with object.
Version 14.231: Required update due to TransferNode object update.
Version 14.231: Added Consumed Material, Produced Material, Seized Resource, and Released Resource add-on processes.
Version 14.232: Required update due to TransferNode object update.
Version 14.238: Fixes to 'Switch Resources If Possible' off shift rule for secondary resources if multiple resource requirements and enforcing the Must Simultaneously Seize constraint.
Version 15.241: Added new 'Immediately Try Consume' property to Consume step. Added new 'Immediately Try Allocate' property to Produce step. Required update due to TransferNode object update.

Category.Name: Buffer Logic/Parent Input Buffer/Balking & Reneging Options
Category.Description: Parent Input Buffer Balking & Reneging Options

Category.Name: Buffer Logic/Member Input Buffer/Balking & Reneging Options
Category.Description: Member Input Buffer Balking & Reneging Options

Category.Name: Table Row Referencing/Before Processing
Category.Description: Table Row Reference Actions Before Processing

ExpressionProperty.Name: BatchQuantity
ExpressionProperty.Description: The target number of member entities to collect and attach to a parent entity.

EnumProperty.Name: MatchingRule
EnumProperty.Description:
The matching rule used to group member and parent entities together.
If the matching rule is 'Any Entity', then any entity can be grouped with any other entity.
If the matching rule is ‘Match Members’, then member entities must be grouped together using a specified match expression.
If the matching rule is 'Match Members And Parent', then the member entities must also match an expression for the parent entity to attach a group to a parent.

ExpressionProperty.Name: MemberMatchExpression
ExpressionProperty.Description: The expression whose value must be the same between member entities to group them together.

ExpressionProperty.Name: ParentMatchExpression
ExpressionProperty.Description: The expression whose value for a parent entity must be the same as the match expression for the member entities to attach those members to the parent.

RepeatingProperty.Name: BatchQuantities
RepeatingProperty.Description: Additional member entities to collect and attach to a parent entity.

ExpressionProperty.Name: BatchQuantitiesBatchQuantity
ExpressionProperty.Description: The target number of member entities to collect and attach to a parent entity.

EnumProperty.Name: BatchQuantitiesMatchingRule
EnumProperty.Description:
The matching rule used to group member and parent entities together.
If the matching rule is 'Any Entity', then any entity can be grouped with any other entity.
If the matching rule is ‘Match Members’, then member entities must be grouped together using a specified match expression.
If the matching rule is 'Match Members And Parent', then the member entities must also match an expression for the parent entity to attach a group to a parent.

ExpressionProperty.Name: BatchQuantitiesMemberMatchExpression
ExpressionProperty.Description: The expression whose value must be the same between member entities to group them together.

ExpressionProperty.Name: BatchQuantitiesParentMatchExpression
ExpressionProperty.Description: The expression whose value for a parent entity must be the same as the match expression for the member entities to attach those members to the parent.

EnumProperty.Name: ParentRankingRule
EnumProperty.Description: The rule used to rank the order of entities in the parent input buffer of the combiner.

ExpressionProperty.Name: ParentRankingExpression
ExpressionProperty.Description: The expression used with a Smallest Value First or Largest Value First ranking rule.

EnumProperty.Name: MemberRankingRule
EnumProperty.Description: The rule used to rank the order of entities in the member input buffer of the combiner.

ExpressionProperty.Name: MemberRankingExpression
ExpressionProperty.Description: The expression used with a Smallest Value First or Largest Value First ranking rule.

BooleanProperty.Name: MustSimultaneouslyBatch
BooleanProperty.Description: Indicates whether the full target number(s) of member entities must be available before any can be collected and attached to a parent entity. If this property is set to False, then batch members will be collected as soon as they arrive to the combiner’s member input buffer.

RepeatingProperty.Name: ReleaseBatchEarlyTriggers
RepeatingProperty.Description: Optional time or event-driven triggers that can cause a parent entity to be released early before collecting its full target number(s) of member entities.

EnumProperty.Name: ReleaseBatchEarlyTriggerType
EnumProperty.Description:
The type of trigger.
A time based trigger can release a batch early once a specified wait duration expires.
An event based trigger can release a batch early whenever a specified event occurs.

ExpressionProperty.Name: ReleaseBatchEarlyWaitDuration
ExpressionProperty.Description: The wait duration until deciding whether to release a batch early.

EventProperty.Name: ReleaseBatchEarlyTriggeringEventName
EventProperty.Description: The name of the event whose occurrence will trigger a decision whether to release a batch early.

EnumProperty.Name: ReleaseBatchEarlyDecisionType
EnumProperty.Description: The method used when the trigger has fired to decide whether to release a batch early.

ExpressionProperty.Name: ReleaseBatchEarlyConditionOrProbability
ExpressionProperty.Description: The release condition or probability specified as an expression. If a probability then enter the chance of releasing the batch early as a value between 0.0 (0%) and 1.0 (100%).

BooleanProperty.Name: SuspendBatchingWhenDown
BooleanProperty.Description: Indicates whether to suspend collecting batches if the combiner has failed or is at the end of a shift because of its specified work schedule.

ExpressionProperty.Name: ParentTransferInTime
ExpressionProperty.Description: The time required to transfer a parent entity into this object.

ExpressionProperty.Name: MemberTransferInTime
ExpressionProperty.Description: The time required to transfer a member entity into this object.

EnumProperty.Name: ProcessType
EnumProperty.Description: The method used to model the processing of a parent entity once its batch has been formed.

ExpressionProperty.Name: ProcessingTime
ExpressionProperty.Description: The time required to process a parent entity once its batch has been formed.

RepeatingProperty.Name: ProcessingTasks
RepeatingProperty.Description: The set of tasks required to process a parent entity once its batch has been formed.

IntegerProperty.Name: TaskIDNumber
IntegerProperty.Description: Integer number used to identify the task in the Immediate Predecessors or Immediate Successors field of another task.

SequenceNumberProperty.Name: TaskSequenceNumber
SequenceNumberProperty.Description:
Sequence number used to define the task precedence constraints. To model a task sequence that is simply a serially ordered set of tasks, define the tasks with increasing sequence numbers (e.g., the first task is numbered '10', the second task is numbered '20', and so forth). Tasks with identical sequence numbers will be performed in parallel.
For a more in-depth discussion on task sequence numbering including examples of how to model parallel subsequences, please refer to the Task Sequence element documentation.

EnumProperty.Name: TaskBranchType
EnumProperty.Description:
Indicates whether the task is always performed, or whether it is instead treated as the first task of a conditional or probabilistic branch in the process workflow.
If the branch type is ‘Conditional’, then the task is performed if the specified logical condition evaluates to True. Otherwise, the task is cancelled.
The ‘Probabilistic’ branch type may be used to identify the task as one of possibly several mutually exclusive alternatives at a probabilistic decision point. The sum of the branch probabilities at a probabilistic decision point cannot be greater than one.
If the branch type is ‘Independent Probabilistic’, then the task’s specified probability is independent of and thus not affected by other probabilistic branching. For example, if a decision point has two task branches each with an ‘independent’ probability of 0.5 (50% chance), then that indicates either, both, or neither of the branches might be required to occur. And the probability of both branches being required is (0.5)*(0.5) = 0.25 (25% chance).

ExpressionProperty.Name: TaskConditionOrProbability
ExpressionProperty.Description: The branch condition or probability specified as an expression. If a condition then enter the logical condition. If a probability then enter the chance of performing the task as a value between 0.0 (0%) and 1.0 (100%).

EnumProperty.Name: TaskProcessType
EnumProperty.Description: The method used to model the processing of the task.

ExpressionProperty.Name: TaskProcessingTime
ExpressionProperty.Description: The time required to perform the task.

ElementProperty.Name: TaskProcessName
ElementProperty.Description: The name of the process that will be executed in order to perform the task. The task will be considered finished once this invoked process has ended.

EnumProperty.Name: TaskSubmodelEntityCreationMethod
EnumProperty.Description:
The method used to create an entity that will be sent to some other distinct part of the overall model. The task will be considered finished once this created submodel entity has ended its processing (i.e., been destroyed).
If copying the original entity's attributes, then all possible state values and table references will be copied from the original entity to the created submodel entity.

DynamicObjectInstanceProperty.Name: TaskSubmodelEntityType
DynamicObjectInstanceProperty.Description: The entity type of the created submodel entity.

NodeProperty.Name: TaskSubmodelStartingNode
NodeProperty.Description: The facility node location that the created submodel entity will be sent to in order to start its processing.

StateProperty.Name: TaskSaveOriginalEntityReference
StateProperty.Description: Optional entity reference state variable to save a reference to the original entity being processed at the server. Typically is a state variable defined on the created submodel entity, to allow easy access by that entity to the original entity's attributes.

ElementProperty.Name: TaskChangeoverLogicName
ElementProperty.Description:
The name of the Changeover Logic element used to determine any sequence dependent setup times.
Go to Definitions->Elements to add a new Changeover Logic element to the model.

EnumProperty.Name: TaskResourceEfficiencyRule
EnumProperty.Description:
The processing rule used to alter the rate at which the task is performed if there are seized resources with defined efficiency values. The actual task duration is the planned task duration divided by the efficiency.
If the rule is ‘None’, then seized resource efficiency is ignored.
If the rule is ‘Average’, then the average seized resource efficiency value is used.
If the rule is ‘Count’, then the number of seized resources with a defined efficiency value is used.
If the rule is ‘Maximum’, then the largest efficiency value is used.
If the rule is ‘Minimum’, then the smallest efficiency value is used.
If the rule is ‘Sum’, then the sum of the seized resource efficiency values is used.

TaskDependencyProperty.Name: TaskImmediatePredecessors
TaskDependencyProperty.Description: Lists the ID numbers of the tasks which must be finished or cancelled before this task can start. To specify more than one predecessor, enter multiple task ID numbers separated by commas.

TaskDependencyProperty.Name: TaskImmediateSuccessors
TaskDependencyProperty.Description: Lists the ID numbers of the tasks which can't start until this task is finished or cancelled. To specify more than one successor, enter multiple task ID numbers separated by commas.

EnumProperty.Name: TaskAutoCancelTrigger
EnumProperty.Description:
Event type that will trigger an automatic cancellation of the task.
The default setting is 'All Immediate Predecessors Cancelled', which indicates the task will be automatically cancelled if all its immediate predecessors in the task sequence are cancelled. This default setting is recommended if you want conditional or probabilistic branching to automatically cancel all tasks in unselected branches.
For a more in-depth discussion of this option including examples, please refer to the Task Sequence element documentation.

EnumProperty.Name: TaskResourceRequirementsResourceType
EnumProperty.Description: The method for specifying the resource object(s) to seize.

ObjectInstanceProperty.Name: TaskResourceRequirementsResourceName
ObjectInstanceProperty.Description: The name of the resource object to seize.

ListNameProperty.Name: TaskResourceRequirementsResourceListName
ListNameProperty.Description: The name of the object list from which to select the resource object(s) to seize.

EnumProperty.Name: TaskResourceRequirementsSelectionGoal
EnumProperty.Description: The rule used to select a resource object from multiple candidates.

ExpressionProperty.Name: TaskResourceRequirementsSelectionValueExpression
ExpressionProperty.Description:
The expression used to get the value for each candidate resource.
In the expression, use the syntax Candidate.[ObjectClass].[Attribute] to reference an attribute of the candidate resource objects (e.g., Candidate.Object.Capacity).

EnumProperty.Name: TaskResourceRequirementsRequestMove
EnumProperty.Description: Indicates whether a move to a specified node will be requested from the seized resource(s). The task will not be able to start until arrival of the resource(s) at the node location.

NodeProperty.Name: TaskResourceRequirementsDestinationNode
NodeProperty.Description: The name of the destination node that the seized resource(s) will be requested to move to.

ListProperty.Name: TaskResourceRequirementsOffShiftRule
ListProperty.Description:
The processing rule used if a resource is at the end of a shift because of its specified work schedule.
Suspend Processing - The processing of the task will be immediately suspended. Processing will resume at the start of the resource’s next shift.
Finish Work Already Started - The processing of the task will be allowed to continue until finished. The resource will not be allowed to accept any new work.
Switch Resources If Possible - The processing of the task will be immediately suspended. The affected entity will then try to resume the task’s processing as soon as possible by releasing the resource and seizing another available one that satisfies the same task resource requirements.
NOTE: This property setting may vary from task to task but not from resource requirement to resource requirement for the same task. Thus, if using a table driven approach to define task sequence data, the value of this property may only be specified as a constant or by referencing a column in the table that defines each individual processing task.

ExpressionProperty.Name: TaskResourceRequirementsNumberOfResources
ExpressionProperty.Description: The number of individual resource objects to seize capacity units of.

ExpressionProperty.Name: TaskResourceRequirementsUnitsPerResource
ExpressionProperty.Description:
The number of capacity units to seize per candidate resource.
In the expression, use the syntax Candidate.[ObjectClass].[Attribute] to reference an attribute of the candidate resource objects (e.g., Candidate.Object.Capacity).

ExpressionProperty.Name: TaskResourceRequirementsSelectionCondition
ExpressionProperty.Description:
Optional condition evaluated for each candidate resource that must be true for the resource to be selected.
In the expression, use the syntax Candidate.[ObjectClass].[Attribute] to reference an attribute of the candidate resource objects (e.g., Candidate.Object.Capacity).

ExpressionProperty.Name: TaskResourceRequirementsResourceEfficiency
ExpressionProperty.Description:
Optional value that can alter the rate at which the task is performed using the seized resource(s), expressed as a fraction. The actual task duration is the planned task duration divided by the efficiency. Hence, an efficiency value greater than 1 shortens the time and a value less than 1 lengthens the time.
In the expression, use the syntax Candidate.[ObjectClass].[Attribute] to reference an attribute of the candidate resource objects (e.g., Candidate.Object.Capacity).
Set this property to blank to declare the resource efficiency as undefined.

BooleanProperty.Name: TaskResourceRequirementsMustSimultaneouslySeize
BooleanProperty.Description:
If multiple resources are required for the task, indicates whether all of the resources must be available before any can be seized.
NOTE: This property setting may vary from task to task but not from resource requirement to resource requirement for the same task. Thus, if using a table driven approach to define task sequence data, the value of this property may only be specified as a constant or by referencing a column in the table that defines each individual processing task.

BooleanProperty.Name: TaskResourceRequirementsImmediatelyTrySeize
BooleanProperty.Description:
Indicates whether to immediately try seizing the task resource requirements before the execution of any other simulation logic in the system and, if successful, skipping the resource allocation queues.
Setting this property to False will just insert the seize request into the resource allocation queues. An evaluation of those queues will then be scheduled on the simulation’s current event calendar as a late priority event.
NOTE: This property setting may vary from task to task but not from resource requirement to resource requirement for the same task. Thus, if using a table driven approach to define task sequence data, the value of this property may only be specified as a constant or by referencing a column in the table that defines each individual processing task.

ExpressionProperty.Name: TaskResourceRequirementsKeepReservedCondition
ExpressionProperty.Description:
Once the task has completed and released the resource requirements, an optional condition indicating whether to keep the released resource capacity reserved for possible later reuse by the same entity. Other entities will be unable to use a reserved resource unless the reservation is cancelled.
In the expression, use the syntax Candidate.[ObjectClass].[Attribute] to reference an attribute of the task resource object(s) being released (e.g., Candidate.Object.Capacity).
Note that when an entity is attempting to select a resource from a group of candidates (e.g., from a list or from a population of some resource type), by default a preference will be given to select a resource that has already been reserved by that entity irrespective of the specified selection goal.
Leaving this property blank (no condition) is equivalent to entering False.

ExpressionProperty.Name: TaskResourceRequirementsReservationTimeout
ExpressionProperty.Description:
If the keep reserved condition is true, then an optional wait time before automatically cancelling the reservation.
In the expression, use the syntax Candidate.[ObjectClass].[Attribute] to reference an attribute of the task resource object(s) being released (e.g., Candidate.Object.Capacity).

BooleanProperty.Name: TaskResourceRequirementsImmediatelyTryAllocateWhenReleased
BooleanProperty.Description:
Once the task has completed and released the resource requirements, indicates whether to immediately try allocating the released resource capacity to waiting seize requests before the execution of any other simulation logic in the system.
Setting this property to False will skip immediate allocation. Instead, an evaluation of the resource allocation queues will be scheduled on the simulation’s current event calendar as a late priority event.
NOTE: This property setting may vary from task to task but not from resource requirement to resource requirement for the same task. Thus, if using a table driven approach to define task sequence data, the value of this property may only be specified as a constant or by referencing a column in the table that defines each individual processing task.

ExpressionProperty.Name: TaskResourceRequirementsSkipRequirementCondition
ExpressionProperty.Description: Optional condition indicating whether to skip the resource requirement. Is evaluated only once per task, at the start of execution of the underlying Seize step.

EnumProperty.Name: TaskMaterialRequirementsActionType
EnumProperty.Description: The type of material-related action required.

EnumProperty.Name: TaskMaterialRequirementsConsumptionType
EnumProperty.Description: Indicates whether to consume a single material or a bill of materials. The material consumption will be required to start the processing of the task.

EnumProperty.Name: TaskMaterialRequirementsProductionType
EnumProperty.Description: Indicates whether to produce a single material or a bill of materials. The material production will occur after finishing the processing of the task.

ElementProperty.Name: TaskMaterialRequirementsMaterialName
ElementProperty.Description: The name of the material which is to be either specifically consumed or produced, or whose bill of materials is to be consumed or produced.

EnumProperty.Name: TaskMaterialRequirementsInventorySiteType
EnumProperty.Description:
Indicates the fixed object that is the inventory location. Applies only to material elements whose Location Based Inventory property is set to True.
The 'ParentObject' setting may be used to indicate that the inventory site is the server, combiner, or separator.

ObjectInstanceProperty.Name: TaskMaterialRequirementsSiteObjectName
ObjectInstanceProperty.Description: The name of the fixed object that is the inventory location.

ExpressionProperty.Name: TaskMaterialRequirementsQuantity
ExpressionProperty.Description: The quantity to be consumed or produced.

ExpressionProperty.Name: TaskMaterialRequirementsLotID
ExpressionProperty.Description: Optional string value indicating the lot identifier of the consumed or produced material.

BooleanProperty.Name: TaskMaterialRequirementsMustSimultaneouslyConsume
BooleanProperty.Description:
Indicates whether all of the task's required materials must be available before any can be consumed.
NOTE: This property setting may vary from task to task but not from material requirement to material requirement for the same task. Thus, if using a table driven approach to define task sequence data, the value of this property may only be specified as a constant or by referencing a column in the table that defines each individual processing task.

ExpressionProperty.Name: TaskMaterialRequirementsProductionDelayTime
ExpressionProperty.Description:
Optional delay time after task is finished before producing the material and adding it to inventory.
NOTE: This property has been deprecated. Use a Delay step or additional task instead. To edit a deprecated property, go to File->Settings->GUI->Display Deprecated Properties In Properties Window and change that setting to True.

ExpressionProperty.Name: TaskMaterialRequirementsSkipRequirementCondition
ExpressionProperty.Description: Optional condition indicating whether to skip the material requirement. Is evaluated only once per task, at the start of execution of the underlying Consume or Produce step.

ListProperty.Name: TaskStateAssignmentsTrigger
ListProperty.Description:
Indicates when to perform the state assignment.
‘Task Ready’ is when all of the task’s predecessor dependencies have been satisfied and the entity is about to try seizing or consuming the resources and materials needed (if any) to perform the task.
‘Starting Task’ is when all of the task's resource and material requirements (if any) have been satisfied and the processing of the task is about to begin.
‘Finished Task’ is when the processing of the task has been finished.

StateProperty.Name: TaskStateAssignmentsStateVariableName
StateProperty.Description: Name of the state variable that will be assigned a new value.

ExpressionProperty.Name: TaskStateAssignmentsNewValue
ExpressionProperty.Description: The new value to assign.

ElementProperty.Name: TaskReadyAddOnProcess
ElementProperty.Description: Occurs when the task’s predecessor dependencies have all been satisfied and the entity is about to try seizing or consuming the resources and materials needed (if any) to perform the task.

ElementProperty.Name: StartingTaskAddOnProcess
ElementProperty.Description: Occurs when the task's resource and material requirements (if any) have all been satisfied and the processing of the task is about to begin.

ElementProperty.Name: FinishedTaskAddOnProcess
ElementProperty.Description: Occurs when the processing of the task has finished.

ElementProperty.Name: SeizedResourceAddOnProcess
ElementProperty.Description: Occurs when a resource required to perform the task has been seized.

ElementProperty.Name: ReleasedResourceAddOnProcess
ElementProperty.Description: Occurs when a resource after finishing the task has been released.

ElementProperty.Name: ConsumedMaterialAddOnProcess
ElementProperty.Description: Occurs when a material required to perform the task has been consumed.

ElementProperty.Name: ProducedMaterialAddOnProcess
ElementProperty.Description: Occurs when a material after finishing the task has been produced.

RepeatingProperty.Name: ProcessingLoopbackBranches
RepeatingProperty.Description: Conditional or probabilistic loopback branches in the task workflow.

IntegerProperty.Name: LoopbackFromTaskIDNumber
IntegerProperty.Description: The task ID number that is the beginning of the loopback.

IntegerProperty.Name: LoopbackToTaskIDNumber
IntegerProperty.Description: The task ID number that is the end of the loopback.

SequenceNumberProperty.Name: LoopbackFromTaskSequenceNumber
SequenceNumberProperty.Description: The task sequence number that is the beginning of the loopback.

SequenceNumberProperty.Name: LoopbackToTaskSequenceNumber
SequenceNumberProperty.Description: The task sequence number that is the end of the loopback.

EnumProperty.Name: LoopbackBranchType
EnumProperty.Description:
Indicates whether the loopback is a conditional or probabilistic branch in the task workflow.
If the branch type is 'Conditional', then the loopback occurs if the specified logical condition evaluates to True.
The 'Probabilistic' branch type may be used to identify the loopback as one of possibly several mutually exclusive alternatives at a probabilistic decision point. The sum of the branch probabilities at a probabilistic decision point cannot be greater than one.

ExpressionProperty.Name: LoopbackConditionOrProbability
ExpressionProperty.Description: The branch condition or probability specified as an expression. If a condition then enter the logical condition. If a probability then enter the chance of the loopback as a value between 0.0 (0%) and 1.0 (100%).

EnumProperty.Name: ProcessingTaskPrecedenceMethod
EnumProperty.Description: The method used to define the task precedence dependencies. Can be either by specifying task sequence numbers, specifying the immediate predecessors for each task, or specifying the immediate successors for each task.

TableProperty.Name: ProcessingTaskResourcesReferencedTableName
TableProperty.Description: The name of the data table to be used as the referenced data source for getting task resource requirements.

TableProperty.Name: ProcessingTaskMaterialsReferencedTableName
TableProperty.Description: The name of the data table to be used as the referenced data source for getting task material requirements.

TableProperty.Name: ProcessingTaskStateAssignmentsReferencedTableName
TableProperty.DisplayName: Task State Assignments Referenced Table Name
TableProperty.Description: The name of the data table to be used as the referenced data source for getting task state assignments.

ExpressionProperty.Name: ProcessingTaskSequenceRandomNumberStream
ExpressionProperty.DisplayName: Processing Task Sequence Random Number Stream
ExpressionProperty.Description: The random number stream to be used if there is probabilistic branching in the task sequence.

ListProperty.Name: OffShiftRule
ListProperty.Description:
The processing rule used if the combiner is at the end of a shift because of its specified work schedule.
Suspend Processing - The combiner will immediately suspend all processing and set its resource state to 'OffShift'. Processing will resume at the start of the next shift.
Finish Work Already Started - The combiner will not accept any new entities but will continue processing if necessary to finish work already started. The server's resource state will be set to 'OffShiftProcessing' if processing entities during an off-shift period.

EnumProperty.Name: ResourceEfficiencyRule
EnumProperty.Description:
The processing rule used to alter the rate at which work is performed if there are seized resources with defined efficiency values. The actual work duration is the planned work duration divided by the efficiency.
If the rule is ‘None’, then seized resource efficiency is ignored.
If the rule is ‘Average’, then the average seized resource efficiency value is used.
If the rule is ‘Count’, then the number of seized resources with a defined efficiency value is used.
If the rule is ‘Maximum’, then the largest efficiency value is used.
If the rule is ‘Minimum’, then the smallest efficiency value is used.
If the rule is ‘Sum’, then the sum of the seized resource efficiency values is used.

RepeatingProperty.Name: SeizeConstraintLogic
RepeatingProperty.Description: Constraint logic used to enforce additional constraints on an entity's request to seize the combiner.

ElementProperty.Name: SeizeConstraintLogicName
ElementProperty.Description: The name of the Constraint Logic element used to enforce additional constraints on an entity's request to seize the combiner.

BooleanProperty.Name: ImmediatelyTrySeize
BooleanProperty.Description:
For a parent entity that has collected its batch, indicates whether to immediately try seizing the combiner before the execution of any other simulation logic in the system and, if successful, skipping the combiner’s allocation queue.
Setting this property to False will just insert the seize request into the combiner’s allocation queue. An evaluation of that queue will then be scheduled on the simulation’s current event calendar as a late priority event.

BooleanProperty.Name: ImmediatelyTryAllocateWhenReleased
BooleanProperty.Description:
Once a parent entity has exited processing and released the combiner, indicates whether to immediately try allocating the released combiner capacity to waiting seize requests before the execution of any other simulation logic in the system.
Setting this property to False will skip immediate allocation. Instead, an evaluation of the combiner’s allocation queue will be scheduled on the simulation’s current event calendar as a late priority event.

IntegerProperty.Name: ParentInputBufferCapacity
IntegerProperty.Description: The number of discrete entities that can be held in the buffer.

EnumProperty.Name: ParentInputBufferBalkDecisionType
EnumProperty.Description:
The method used by an entity to decide whether to balk at entering the buffer.
If the decision type is ‘Blocked’, then an entity attempting to enter the buffer will balk if the buffer is full rather than be blocked. Or, if a zero capacity buffer, the entity will balk if its attempt to transfer directly into or out of the object is blocked.
EnumProperty.Category: Buffer Logic/Parent Input Buffer/Balking & Reneging Options

ExpressionProperty.Name: ParentInputBufferBalkConditionOrProbability
ExpressionProperty.Description: The balk condition or probability specified as an expression. If a probability then enter the chance of balking as a value between 0.0 (0%) and 1.0 (100%).
ExpressionProperty.Category: Buffer Logic/Parent Input Buffer/Balking & Reneging Options

NodeProperty.Name: ParentInputBufferBalkNodeName
NodeProperty.Description: Facility node location to send an entity that has balked at entering the buffer.
NodeProperty.Category: Buffer Logic/Parent Input Buffer/Balking & Reneging Options

RepeatingProperty.Name: ParentInputBufferRenegeTriggers
RepeatingProperty.Description: Optional time or event-driven triggers that can cause entities to abandon waiting in the buffer.
RepeatingProperty.Category: Buffer Logic/Parent Input Buffer/Balking & Reneging Options

EnumProperty.Name: ParentInputBufferRenegeTriggerType
EnumProperty.Description:
The type of trigger.
A time based trigger can renege an entity from the buffer once a specified wait duration expires.
An event based trigger can renege an entity from the buffer whenever a specified event occurs.

ExpressionProperty.Name: ParentInputBufferRenegeWaitDuration
ExpressionProperty.Description: The wait duration until deciding whether to renege an entity from the buffer.

EventProperty.Name: ParentInputBufferRenegeTriggeringEventName
EventProperty.Description: The name of the event whose occurrence will trigger a decision whether to renege an entity from the buffer.

EnumProperty.Name: ParentInputBufferRenegeDecisionType
EnumProperty.Description: The method used when the trigger has fired to decide whether to renege an entity from the buffer.

ExpressionProperty.Name: ParentInputBufferRenegeConditionOrProbability
ExpressionProperty.Description:
The renege condition or probability specified as an expression. If a probability then enter the chance of reneging as a value between 0.0 (0%) and 1.0 (100%).
NOTE: If it is necessary to check in a conditional expression whether an entity is currently waiting for a specific type of constraint, the entity ‘Queuing’ namespace provides several functions for that purpose (e.g., Entity.Queuing.IsWaitingRidePickupQueue).

NodeProperty.Name: ParentInputBufferRenegeNodeName
NodeProperty.Description: Facility node location to send a reneging entity.

EnumProperty.Name: ParentInputBufferRenegeTriggerStartBoundary
EnumProperty.Description: Indicates when the trigger becomes active for an entity occupying the buffer. Can be either immediately when the entity has entered the buffer or, alternatively, not until its transfer into the buffer has been ended (e.g., after a transfer-in time or any other entry related logic).

IntegerProperty.Name: MemberInputBufferCapacity
IntegerProperty.Description: The number of discrete entities that can be held in the buffer.

EnumProperty.Name: MemberInputBufferBalkDecisionType
EnumProperty.Description:
The method used by an entity to decide whether to balk at entering the buffer.
If the decision type is ‘Blocked’, then an entity attempting to enter the buffer will balk if the buffer is full rather than be blocked. Or, if a zero capacity buffer, the entity will balk if its attempt to transfer directly into or out of the object is blocked.
EnumProperty.Category: Buffer Logic/Member Input Buffer/Balking & Reneging Options

ExpressionProperty.Name: MemberInputBufferBalkConditionOrProbability

ExpressionProperty.Category: Buffer Logic/Member Input Buffer/Balking & Reneging Options

NodeProperty.Name: MemberInputBufferBalkNodeName
NodeProperty.Description: Facility node location to send an entity that has balked at entering the buffer.
NodeProperty.Category: Buffer Logic/Member Input Buffer/Balking & Reneging Options

RepeatingProperty.Name: MemberInputBufferRenegeTriggers
RepeatingProperty.Description: Optional time or event-driven triggers that can cause entities to abandon waiting in the buffer.
RepeatingProperty.Category: Buffer Logic/Member Input Buffer/Balking & Reneging Options

EnumProperty.Name: MemberInputBufferRenegeTriggerType
EnumProperty.Description:
The type of trigger.
A time based trigger can renege an entity from the buffer once a specified wait duration expires.
An event based trigger can renege an entity from the buffer whenever a specified event occurs.

ExpressionProperty.Name: MemberInputBufferRenegeWaitDuration

EventProperty.Name: MemberInputBufferRenegeTriggeringEventName

EnumProperty.Name: MemberInputBufferRenegeDecisionType
EnumProperty.Description: The method used when the trigger has fired to decide whether to renege an entity from the buffer.

ExpressionProperty.Name: MemberInputBufferRenegeConditionOrProbability

The renege condition or probability specified as an expression. If a probability then enter the chance of reneging as a value between 0.0 (0%) and 1.0 (100%).

NodeProperty.Name: MemberInputBufferRenegeNodeName
NodeProperty.Description: Facility node location to send a reneging entity.

EnumProperty.Name: MemberInputBufferRenegeTriggerStartBoundary
EnumProperty.Description: Indicates when the trigger becomes active for an entity occupying the buffer. Can be either immediately when the entity has entered the buffer or, alternatively, not until its transfer into the buffer has been ended (e.g., after a transfer-in time or any other entry related logic).

IntegerProperty.Name: OutputBufferCapacity
IntegerProperty.Description: The number of discrete entities that can be held in the buffer.

EnumProperty.Name: OutputBufferBalkDecisionType

The method used by an entity to decide whether to balk at entering the buffer.
If the decision type is ‘Blocked’, then an entity attempting to enter the buffer will balk if the buffer is full rather than be blocked. Or, if a zero capacity buffer, the entity will balk if its attempt to transfer directly into or out of the object is blocked.

ExpressionProperty.Name: OutputBufferBalkConditionOrProbability

NodeProperty.Name: OutputBufferBalkNodeName
NodeProperty.Description: Facility node location to send an entity that has balked at entering the buffer.

RepeatingProperty.Name: OutputBufferRenegeTriggers
RepeatingProperty.Description: Optional time or event-driven triggers that can cause entities to abandon waiting in the buffer.

EnumProperty.Name: OutputBufferRenegeTriggerType
EnumProperty.Description:
The type of trigger.
A time based trigger can renege an entity from the buffer once a specified wait duration expires.
An event based trigger can renege an entity from the buffer whenever a specified event occurs.

ExpressionProperty.Name: OutputBufferRenegeWaitDuration

EventProperty.Name: OutputBufferRenegeTriggeringEventName
EventProperty.Description: The name of the event whose occurrence will trigger a decision whether to renege an entity from the buffer.

EnumProperty.Name: OutputBufferRenegeDecisionType
EnumProperty.Description: The method used when the trigger has fired to decide whether to renege an entity from the buffer.

ExpressionProperty.Name: OutputBufferRenegeConditionOrProbability

The renege condition or probability specified as an expression. If a probability then enter the chance of reneging as a value between 0.0 (0%) and 1.0 (100%).
NOTE: If it is necessary to check in a conditional expression whether an entity is currently waiting for a specific type of constraint, the entity ‘Queuing’ namespace provides several functions for that purpose (e.g., Entity.Queuing.IsWaitingRidePickupQueue).

NodeProperty.Name: OutputBufferRenegeNodeName

EnumProperty.Name: OutputBufferRenegeTriggerStartBoundary

Can be either immediately when the entity has entered the buffer or, alternatively, not until its transfer into the buffer has been ended (e.g., after a transfer-in time or any other entry related logic).

ListProperty.Name: FailureType
ListProperty.Description: Specifies whether this object has failures that affect the object's availability, and the method used to trigger the failure occurrences.

EventProperty.Name: FailureEventName
EventProperty.Description: The name of the event whose occurrences determine when the next failure occurs.

ExpressionProperty.Name: CountBetweenFailures
ExpressionProperty.Description: The event or processing count between failure occurrences.

ExpressionProperty.Name: UptimeBetweenFailures
ExpressionProperty.Description: The uptime between failure occurrences.

ExpressionProperty.Name: TimeToRepair
ExpressionProperty.Description: The time required to repair a failure when one occurs.

EnumProperty.Name: TableRowReferenceBeforeProcessingActionType
EnumProperty.Description:
The type of table row reference action to perform.
The ‘Reference Existing Row’ action type may be used to set a reference to an existing row in a data table or sequence table. The row index into the table is specified by the Row Number property.
The ‘Add New Row’ action type may be used to add a new row to an output table. A reference will be automatically set to the newly added row.

ExpressionProperty.Name: TableRowReferenceBeforeProcessingRowNumber
ExpressionProperty.Description: The one-based row index into the table.

RepeatingProperty.Name: AssignmentsOnParentEntering
RepeatingProperty.Description: Optional state assignments when a parent entity is entering the object.

StateProperty.Name: AssignmentsOnParentEnteringStateVariableName
StateProperty.Description: Name of the state variable that will be assigned a new value.

ExpressionProperty.Name: AssignmentsOnParentEnteringNewValue
ExpressionProperty.Description: The new value to assign.

RepeatingProperty.Name: AssignmentsOnMemberEntering
RepeatingProperty.Description: Optional state assignments when a member entity is entering the object.

StateProperty.Name: AssignmentsOnMemberEnteringStateVariableName
StateProperty.Description: Name of the state variable that will be assigned a new value.

ExpressionProperty.Name: AssignmentsOnMemberEnteringNewValue
ExpressionProperty.Description: The new value to assign.

RepeatingProperty.Name: AssignmentsBeforeProcessing
RepeatingProperty.Description: Optional state assignments when a batch has been formed and the parent entity has been allocated capacity to be processed at the object, but before entering (or ending transfer into) the object's processing station.

StateProperty.Name: AssignmentsBeforeProcessingStateVariableName
StateProperty.Description: Name of the state variable that will be assigned a new value.

ExpressionProperty.Name: AssignmentsBeforeProcessingNewValue
ExpressionProperty.Description: The new value to assign.

RepeatingProperty.Name: AssignmentsAfterProcessing
RepeatingProperty.Description: Optional state assignments when an entity has completed its processing and is about to attempt its exit from the object's processing station.

StateProperty.Name: AssignmentsAfterProcessingStateVariableName
StateProperty.Description: Name of the state variable that will be assigned a new value.

ExpressionProperty.Name: AssignmentsAfterProcessingNewValue
ExpressionProperty.Description: The new value to assign.

RepeatingProperty.Name: AssignmentsBeforeExiting
RepeatingProperty.Description: Optional state assignments when an entity is ready to exit the object.

StateProperty.Name: AssignmentsBeforeExitingStateVariableName
StateProperty.Description: Name of the state variable that will be assigned a new value.

ExpressionProperty.Name: AssignmentsBeforeExitingNewValue
ExpressionProperty.Description: The new value to assign.

RepeatingProperty.Name: AssignmentsOnBalking
RepeatingProperty.Description: Optional state assignments when an entity is balking at entering an input or output buffer of the object.

ListProperty.Name: AssignmentsOnBalkingAssignConditionType
ListProperty.Description: Condition required to perform the assignment.

ExpressionProperty.Name: AssignmentsOnBalkingAssignCondition
ExpressionProperty.Description: The condition required to perform the assignment.

StateProperty.Name: AssignmentsOnBalkingStateVariableName
StateProperty.Description: Name of the state variable that will be assigned a new value.

ExpressionProperty.Name: AssignmentsOnBalkingNewValue
ExpressionProperty.Description: The new value to assign.

RepeatingProperty.Name: AssignmentsOnReneging
RepeatingProperty.Description: Optional state assignments when an entity is reneging from an input or output buffer of the object.

ListProperty.Name: AssignmentsOnRenegingAssignConditionType
ListProperty.Description: Condition required to perform the assignment.

ExpressionProperty.Name: AssignmentsOnRenegingAssignCondition
ExpressionProperty.Description: The condition required to perform the assignment.

StateProperty.Name: AssignmentsOnRenegingStateVariableName
StateProperty.Description: Name of the state variable that will be assigned a new value.

ExpressionProperty.Name: AssignmentsOnRenegingNewValue
ExpressionProperty.Description: The new value to assign.

BooleanProperty.Name: SecondaryResourcesForProcessingIsRepeatGroup
BooleanProperty.Description: Indicates whether a repeat group data structure is used to define the secondary resources for processing.

RepeatingProperty.Name: SecondaryResourcesForProcessing
RepeatingProperty.Description: The secondary resources required to process an entity.

EnumProperty.Name: SecondaryResourcesForProcessingResourceType
EnumProperty.Description: The method for specifying the resource object(s) to seize.

ObjectInstanceProperty.Name: SecondaryResourcesForProcessingResourceName
ObjectInstanceProperty.Description: The name of the resource object to seize.

ListNameProperty.Name: SecondaryResourcesForProcessingResourceListName
ListNameProperty.Description: The name of the object list from which to select the resource object(s) to seize.

EnumProperty.Name: SecondaryResourcesForProcessingSelectionGoal
EnumProperty.Description: The rule used to select a resource object from multiple candidates.

ExpressionProperty.Name: SecondaryResourcesForProcessingSelectionValueExpression
ExpressionProperty.Description:
The expression used to get the value for each candidate resource.
In the expression, use the syntax Candidate.[ObjectClass].[Attribute] to reference an attribute of the candidate resource objects (e.g., Candidate.Object.Capacity).

EnumProperty.Name: SecondaryResourcesForProcessingRequestMove
EnumProperty.Description: Indicates whether a move to a specified node will be requested from the seized resource(s). Processing will not be able to continue until arrival of the resources at the node location.

NodeProperty.Name: SecondaryResourcesForProcessingDestinationNode
NodeProperty.Description: The name of the destination node that the seized resource(s) will be requested to move to.

ExpressionProperty.Name: SecondaryResourcesForProcessingNumberOfResources
ExpressionProperty.Description: The number of individual resource objects to seize capacity units of.

ExpressionProperty.Name: SecondaryResourcesForProcessingUnitsPerResource
ExpressionProperty.Description:
The number of capacity units to seize per candidate resource.
In the expression, use the syntax Candidate.[ObjectClass].[Attribute] to reference an attribute of the candidate resource objects (e.g., Candidate.Object.Capacity).

ExpressionProperty.Name: SecondaryResourcesForProcessingSelectionCondition
ExpressionProperty.Description:
Optional condition evaluated for each candidate resource that must be true for the resource to be selected.
In the expression, use the syntax Candidate.[ObjectClass].[Attribute] to reference an attribute of the candidate resource objects (e.g., Candidate.Object.Capacity).

ExpressionProperty.Name: SecondaryResourcesForProcessingResourceEfficiency
ExpressionProperty.Description:
Optional value that can alter the rate at which work is performed using the seized resource(s), expressed as a fraction. The actual work duration is the planned work duration divided by the efficiency. Hence, an efficiency value greater than 1 shortens the time and a value less than 1 lengthens the time.
In the expression, use the syntax Candidate.[ObjectClass].[Attribute] to reference an attribute of the candidate resource objects (e.g., Candidate.Object.Capacity).
Set this property to blank to declare the resource efficiency as undefined.

ExpressionProperty.Name: SecondaryResourcesForProcessingKeepReservedCondition
ExpressionProperty.Description:
Once an entity has completed processing and released the resource requirements, an optional condition indicating whether to keep the released resource capacity reserved for possible later reuse by the same entity. Other entities will be unable to use a reserved resource unless the reservation is cancelled.
In the expression, use the syntax Candidate.[ObjectClass].[Attribute] to reference an attribute of the candidate resource object being released (e.g., Candidate.Object.Capacity).
Note that when an entity is attempting to select a resource from a group of candidates (e.g., from a list or from a population of some resource type), by default a preference will be given to select a resource that has already been reserved by that entity irrespective of the specified selection goal.
Leaving this property blank (no condition) is equivalent to entering False.

ExpressionProperty.Name: SecondaryResourcesForProcessingReservationTimeout
ExpressionProperty.Description:
If the keep reserved condition is true, then an optional wait time before automatically cancelling the reservation.
In the expression, use the syntax Candidate.[ObjectClass].[Attribute] to reference an attribute of resource object(s) being released (e.g., Candidate.Object.Capacity).

ExpressionProperty.Name: SecondaryResourcesForProcessingSkipRequirementCondition
ExpressionProperty.Description: Optional condition indicating whether to skip the resource requirement.

EnumProperty.Name: SecondaryResourceForProcessingResourceType
EnumProperty.Description: The method for specifying the resource object(s) to seize.

ObjectInstanceProperty.Name: SecondaryResourceForProcessingResourceName
ObjectInstanceProperty.Description: The name of the resource object to seize.

ListNameProperty.Name: SecondaryResourceForProcessingResourceListName
ListNameProperty.Description: The name of the object list from which to select the resource object(s) to seize.

EnumProperty.Name: SecondaryResourceForProcessingSelectionGoal
EnumProperty.Description: The rule used to select a resource object from multiple candidates.

ExpressionProperty.Name: SecondaryResourceForProcessingSelectionValueExpression
ExpressionProperty.Description:
The expression used to get the value for each candidate resource.
In the expression, use the syntax Candidate.[ObjectClass].[Attribute] to reference an attribute of the candidate resource objects (e.g., Candidate.Object.Capacity).

EnumProperty.Name: SecondaryResourceForProcessingRequestMove
EnumProperty.Description: Indicates whether a move to a specified node will be requested from the seized resource(s). Processing will not be able to continue until arrival of the resources at the node location.

NodeProperty.Name: SecondaryResourceForProcessingDestinationNode
NodeProperty.Description: The name of the destination node that the seized resource(s) will be requested to move to.

ListProperty.Name: SecondaryResourcesForProcessingOffShiftRule
ListProperty.Description:
The processing rule used if a resource is at the end of a shift because of its specified work schedule.
Suspend Processing - The processing of the entity that is using the resource will be immediately suspended. Processing will resume at the start of the resource’s next shift.
Finish Work Already Started - The processing of the entity that is using the resource will be allowed to continue until finished. The resource will not be allowed to accept any new work.
Switch Resources If Possible - The processing of the entity that is using the resource will be immediately suspended. The entity will then try to resume processing as soon as possible by releasing the resource and seizing another available one that satisfies the same resource requirements.

ExpressionProperty.Name: SecondaryResourceForProcessingNumberOfResources
ExpressionProperty.Description: The number of individual resource objects to seize capacity units of.

ExpressionProperty.Name: SecondaryResourceForProcessingUnitsPerResource
ExpressionProperty.Description:
The number of capacity units to seize per candidate resource.
In the expression, use the syntax Candidate.[ObjectClass].[Attribute] to reference an attribute of the candidate resource objects (e.g., Candidate.Object.Capacity).

ExpressionProperty.Name: SecondaryResourceForProcessingSelectionCondition
ExpressionProperty.Description:
Optional condition evaluated for each candidate resource that must be true for the resource to be selected.
In the expression, use the syntax Candidate.[ObjectClass].[Attribute] to reference an attribute of the candidate resource objects (e.g., Candidate.Object.Capacity).

ExpressionProperty.Name: SecondaryResourceForProcessingResourceEfficiency
ExpressionProperty.Description:
Optional value that can alter the rate at which work is performed using the seized resource(s), expressed as a fraction. The actual work duration is the planned work duration divided by the efficiency. Hence, an efficiency value greater than 1 shortens the time and a value less than 1 lengthens the time.
In the expression, use the syntax Candidate.[ObjectClass].[Attribute] to reference an attribute of the candidate resource objects (e.g., Candidate.Object.Capacity).
Set this property to blank to declare the resource efficiency as undefined.

BooleanProperty.Name: SecondaryResourcesForProcessingMustSimultaneouslySeize
BooleanProperty.Description: If multiple resources are required, indicates whether all of the resources must be available before any can be seized.

BooleanProperty.Name: SecondaryResourcesForProcessingImmediatelyTrySeize
BooleanProperty.Description:
Indicates whether to immediately try seizing the resource requirements before the execution of any other simulation logic in the system and, if successful, skipping the resource allocation queues.
Setting this property to False will just insert the seize request into the resource allocation queues. An evaluation of those queues will then be scheduled on the simulation’s current event calendar as a late priority event.

ExpressionProperty.Name: SecondaryResourceForProcessingKeepReservedCondition
ExpressionProperty.Description:
Once an entity has completed processing and released the resource requirements, an optional condition indicating whether to keep the released resource capacity reserved for possible later reuse by the same entity. Other entities will be unable to use a reserved resource unless the reservation is cancelled.
In the expression, use the syntax Candidate.[ObjectClass].[Attribute] to reference an attribute of the candidate resource object being released (e.g., Candidate.Object.Capacity).
Note that when an entity is attempting to select a resource from a group of candidates (e.g., from a list or from a population of some resource type), by default a preference will be given to select a resource that has already been reserved by that entity irrespective of the specified selection goal.
Leaving this property blank (no condition) is equivalent to entering False.

ExpressionProperty.Name: SecondaryResourceForProcessingReservationTimeout
ExpressionProperty.Description:
If the keep reserved condition is true, then an optional wait time before automatically cancelling the reservation.
In the expression, use the syntax Candidate.[ObjectClass].[Attribute] to reference an attribute of resource object(s) being released (e.g., Candidate.Object.Capacity).

BooleanProperty.Name: SecondaryResourcesForProcessingImmediatelyTryAllocateWhenReleased
BooleanProperty.Description:
Once an entity has completed processing and released the resource requirements, indicates whether to immediately try allocating the released resource capacity to waiting seize requests before the execution of any other simulation logic in the system.
Setting this property to False will skip immediate allocation. Instead, an evaluation of the resource allocation queues will be scheduled on the simulation’s current event calendar as a late priority event.

ExpressionProperty.Name: SecondaryResourceForProcessingSkipRequirementCondition
ExpressionProperty.Description: Optional condition indicating whether to skip the resource requirement.

RepeatingProperty.Name: SecondaryResourceSeizesOnParentEntering
RepeatingProperty.Description: Resource seizes when a parent entity is entering the object.

EnumProperty.Name: SecondaryResourceSeizesOnParentEnteringResourceType
EnumProperty.Description: The method for specifying the resource object(s) to seize.

ObjectInstanceProperty.Name: SecondaryResourceSeizesOnParentEnteringResourceName
ObjectInstanceProperty.Description: The name of the resource object to seize.

ListNameProperty.Name: SecondaryResourceSeizesOnParentEnteringResourceListName
ListNameProperty.Description: The name of the object list from which to select the resource object(s) to seize.

EnumProperty.Name: SecondaryResourceSeizesOnParentEnteringSelectionGoal
EnumProperty.Description: The rule used to select a resource object from multiple candidates.

ExpressionProperty.Name: SecondaryResourceSeizesOnParentEnteringSelectionValueExpression
ExpressionProperty.Description:
The expression used to get the value for each candidate resource.
In the expression, use the syntax Candidate.[ObjectClass].[Attribute] to reference an attribute of the candidate resource objects (e.g., Candidate.Object.Capacity).

EnumProperty.Name: SecondaryResourceSeizesOnParentEnteringRequestMove
EnumProperty.Description: Indicates whether a move to a specified node will be requested from the seized resource(s). Processing will not be able to continue until arrival of the resources at the node location.

NodeProperty.Name: SecondaryResourceSeizesOnParentEnteringDestinationNode
NodeProperty.Description: The name of the destination node that the seized resource(s) will be requested to move to.

ExpressionProperty.Name: SecondaryResourceSeizesOnParentEnteringMovePriority
ExpressionProperty.Description: The priority of the move request if a resource is selecting from multiple candidates.

ExpressionProperty.Name: SecondaryResourceSeizesOnParentEnteringNumberOfResources
ExpressionProperty.Description: The number of individual resource objects to seize capacity units of.

ExpressionProperty.Name: SecondaryResourceSeizesOnParentEnteringUnitsPerResource
ExpressionProperty.Description:
The number of capacity units to seize per candidate resource.
In the expression, use the syntax Candidate.[ObjectClass].[Attribute] to reference an attribute of the candidate resource objects (e.g., Candidate.Object.Capacity).

ExpressionProperty.Name: SecondaryResourceSeizesOnParentEnteringSelectionCondition
ExpressionProperty.Description:
Optional condition evaluated for each candidate resource that must be true for the resource to be selected.
In the expression, use the syntax Candidate.[ObjectClass].[Attribute] to reference an attribute of the candidate resource objects (e.g., Candidate.Object.Capacity).

ExpressionProperty.Name: SecondaryResourceSeizesOnParentEnteringResourceEfficiency
ExpressionProperty.Description:
Optional value that can alter the rate at which work is performed using the seized resource(s), expressed as a fraction. The actual work duration is the planned work duration divided by the efficiency. Hence, an efficiency value greater than 1 shortens the time and a value less than 1 lengthens the time.
In the expression, use the syntax Candidate.[ObjectClass].[Attribute] to reference an attribute of the candidate resource objects (e.g., Candidate.Object.Capacity).
Set this property to blank to declare the resource efficiency as undefined.

ElementProperty.Name: SecondaryResourceSeizesOnParentEnteringOnSeizedProcess
ElementProperty.Description: Optional process to be executed when a resource is seized.

ExpressionProperty.Name: SecondaryResourceSeizesOnParentEnteringSkipSeizeCondition
ExpressionProperty.Description: Optional condition indicating whether to skip the seize requirement.

BooleanProperty.Name: SecondaryResourceSeizesOnParentEnteringMustSimultaneouslySeize
BooleanProperty.Description: If multiple resources are required, indicates whether all of the resources must be available before any can be seized.

BooleanProperty.Name: SecondaryResourceSeizesOnParentEnteringImmediatelyTrySeize
BooleanProperty.Description:
Indicates whether to immediately try seizing the resource requirements before the execution of any other simulation logic in the system and, if successful, skipping the resource allocation queues.
Setting this property to False will just insert the seize request into the resource allocation queues. An evaluation of those queues will then be scheduled on the simulation’s current event calendar as a late priority event.

RepeatingProperty.Name: SecondaryResourceSeizesBeforeProcessing
RepeatingProperty.Description: Resource seizes when an entity has been allocated capacity to be processed at the object, but before entering (or ending transfer into) the object's processing station.

EnumProperty.Name: SecondaryResourceSeizesBeforeProcessingResourceType
EnumProperty.Description: The method for specifying the resource object(s) to seize.

ObjectInstanceProperty.Name: SecondaryResourceSeizesBeforeProcessingResourceName
ObjectInstanceProperty.Description: The name of the resource object to seize.

ListNameProperty.Name: SecondaryResourceSeizesBeforeProcessingResourceListName
ListNameProperty.Description: The name of the object list from which to select the resource object(s) to seize.

EnumProperty.Name: SecondaryResourceSeizesBeforeProcessingSelectionGoal
EnumProperty.Description: The rule used to select a resource object from multiple candidates.

ExpressionProperty.Name: SecondaryResourceSeizesBeforeProcessingSelectionValueExpression
ExpressionProperty.Description:
The expression used to get the value for each candidate resource.
In the expression, use the syntax Candidate.[ObjectClass].[Attribute] to reference an attribute of the candidate resource objects (e.g., Candidate.Object.Capacity).

EnumProperty.Name: SecondaryResourceSeizesBeforeProcessingRequestMove
EnumProperty.Description: Indicates whether a move to a specified node will be requested from the seized resource(s). Processing will not be able to continue until arrival of the resources at the node location.

NodeProperty.Name: SecondaryResourceSeizesBeforeProcessingDestinationNode
NodeProperty.Description: The name of the destination node that the seized resource(s) will be requested to move to.

ExpressionProperty.Name: SecondaryResourceSeizesBeforeProcessingMovePriority
ExpressionProperty.Description: The priority of the move request if a resource is selecting from multiple candidates.

ExpressionProperty.Name: SecondaryResourceSeizesBeforeProcessingNumberOfResources
ExpressionProperty.Description: The number of individual resource objects to seize capacity units of.

ExpressionProperty.Name: SecondaryResourceSeizesBeforeProcessingUnitsPerResource
ExpressionProperty.Description:
The number of capacity units to seize per candidate resource.
In the expression, use the syntax Candidate.[ObjectClass].[Attribute] to reference an attribute of the candidate resource objects (e.g., Candidate.Object.Capacity).
